column4: hey, does anyone here have an nvidia 8500 or 8600 graphics card? I am thinking of getting one and just want to know if I can expect to get full 3d support with it in ubuntu?
Or is there somewhere on the net which has a list of currently supported graphic cards?
Nvidia provides great drivers ( though intel's are better... )
so pretty much any nvidia card should work fine with propriety drivers?
AFIK yes
What is the problem?
The alternate cd won't install the base system as it complains about "chroot: cannot execute apt-get"
I'm trying to install the root partition on a software RAID1
Have you tried chrooting in yourself and seeing why apt-get won't run / if it is there?
i've done a chroot /target and that seams to work... but there is no apt-get command available
What about dpkg ?
dpkg is there and it runs... that is it returns the help screen with no paramaters which is expected
You could try installing apt with dpkg
packages.ubuntu.com or on the alternate CD somewhere
would i have to install it in the chroot'd environment?
Yes
doesn't that get cleaned out whenever i try and install the basesystem?
Yes, I was assuming you would just 'apt-get install ubuntu-base' and possibly install GRUB
Not the most convenient solution but it should work
well i can use dpkg to install apt... but it won't let me install because it says it doesn't have rm to clean up
and it seems that indeed i don't have rm installed
do you know if it would be possible to install say dapper desktop onto an existing software raid partition... or can you only install on raid with an alternate cd?
